timeline.bodyText: this.
timeline.author: Zidane

replies.bodyText: That basically means "if the SerializationBehavior is ever switched from NONE to something else, create these directories before saving anything." I'll change the name to something more descriptive.
replies.author: JBYoshi

replies.bodyText: I feeel silly for commenting on this much later on... but he means turn this line into this.impl$directoriesToCreate.add(dir);
replies.author: dualspiral

timeline.message: Implement METADATA_ONLY and fix a few bugs.

timeline.bodyText:
I don't like that this is an overwrite, to be honest, but I see why you've done it.
@Zidane Should we prefer head injection and cancel in this case? I know you've done that in the past. Could also replace with a Redirect followed by a cancellable injection - but that then wanders into LVT land.
timeline.author: dualspiral

+package org.spongepowered.common.mixin.core.world.chunk.storage;
+
+import net.minecraft.world.chunk.storage.RegionFile;
+import net.minecraft.world.chunk.storage.RegionFileCache;
+import org.spongepowered.asm.mixin.Mixin;
+import org.spongepowered.asm.mixin.Overwrite;
+import org.spongepowered.asm.mixin.Shadow;
+import org.spongepowered.asm.mixin.injection.Redirect;
+
+import java.io.DataInputStream;
+import java.io.File;
+
+@Mixin(RegionFileCache.class)
+public abstract class RegionFileCacheMixin {
+
+    @Shadow public static RegionFile getRegionFileIfExists(File worldDir, int chunkX, int chunkZ) {return null;}
+
+    /**
+     * @author JBYoshi
+     * @reason Support for ChunkSerializationBehaviors that don't save chunks:
+     * don't create files if they aren't necessary. (The original method
+     * already returns null if the chunk doesn't exist.)
+     */
+    @Overwrite
+    public static DataInputStream getChunkInputStream(File worldDir, int chunkX, int chunkZ) {

replies.bodyText: If it's been done where we're only checking that the region file is null and if it is, returning null as a fail fast, then it should be a cancellable injection at HEAD.
replies.author: gabizou

replies.bodyText: It would also need a redirect - the original method calls createOrLoadRegionFile instead of getRegionFileIfExists. Is that enough to merit an overwrite, or should I use the redirect and injection?
replies.author: JBYoshi

replies.bodyText: I'd say the overwrite is fine.
replies.author: gabizou

timeline.bodyText: s/listFiles/impl$listFilesIfDirectoryExists
timeline.author: gabizou

timeline.bodyText: Same here
timeline.author: gabizou

timeline.bodyText: prefix with shadow$ ( I get that this is in maintenance, and api-8 branch is moving towards prefixing shadows always, but I'd like to keep it in line here as well).
timeline.author: gabizou

timeline.bodyText: variable can be final.
timeline.author: gabizou

timeline.bodyText: method name needs to reflect what it's actually doing. impl$checkSerializationBehaviorForCanSave or something
timeline.author: gabizou

timeline.bodyText: Same here
timeline.author: gabizou

timeline.bodyText: Prefix with shadow$
timeline.author: gabizou

timeline.bodyText: mkdirs should be actually named what we're doing on top of making directories.
timeline.author: gabizou

timeline.bodyText: change onCheckSessionLock to actually mean what this method is doing.
timeline.author: gabizou

timeline.bodyText: I really don't like this sort of static flag flip and check. Is it possible to add this check through an IPhaseState.allowsFileCreation() method and switching in?
timeline.author: gabizou

timeline.bodyText: Same with here.. Especially since later you do a try block with finally. It screams that the state should be switching in.
timeline.author: gabizou

timeline.bodyText: Does this method have to be public?
timeline.author: gabizou

replies.bodyText: It's used in several mixins in both SpongeCommon and SpongeForge, so making it public is the best option I can see.
replies.author: JBYoshi

timeline.bodyText: If you do end up making this a PhaseTracker.getCurrentState().allowsFileCreation() check, is there a case where this should be checked for threadedness?
timeline.author: gabizou

replies.bodyText: Potentially (if a mod decides to save a world from another thread), although it's very unlikely. I'll add in a check for now, just in case.
replies.author: JBYoshi

timeline.bodyText: Variable should be final
timeline.author: gabizou

timeline.bodyText: Pull out the Sponge.getServer() as a local variable at this point with how many times it's being called.
timeline.author: gabizou

timeline.bodyText: Why the change?
timeline.author: gabizou

timeline.bodyText: Should be explicit with the types here for variable names, if there's an "original" and "re-generated" or "nonSerializedArchetype" make it so, otherwise this looks like obfuscated smurf naming..
timeline.author: gabizou

timeline.bodyText: Can this potentially be pooled?
timeline.author: gabizou

replies.bodyText: I think so. The only state in there is whether files should be created or not, and that's reset every time. I've changed the phase to extend PooledPhaseState.
